techmeme.title: Apple Watch SE 3 review: great value for $249, with an always-on display and 5G connectivity, but an outdated design and no ECG or hypertension alerts (Kate Kozuch/Tom's Guide)
Microsoft announces a $30B investment in the UK over four years to support AI infrastructure and ongoing operations, including $15B to build a supercomputer (Tom Warren/The Verge)
Online services marketplace Fiverr lays off 30% of its workforce, or about 250 people, as part of a restructuring to become "an AI-first company" (Zaheer Kachwala/Reuters)
Trump extends the deadline for ByteDance to divest TikTok's US operations until December 16, the fourth such extension; a deal is expected to be finalized soon (Bloomberg)
Sources: under the US-China framework, a US investor consortium that includes Oracle, Silver Lake, and a16z would hold an ~80% stake in TikTok's US business (Wall Street Journal)
